page.title: 14The Oxford Canal
page.content: The inland Waterways or canals are an interesting feature of our countryside.Their brightly decorated barges can be seen carrying goods between London and other industrial areas. From Coventry's boundary,the Oxford Canal passes Ansty and Brinklow, through Newbold,Clifton upon Dunsmore then on to Hillmorton and Willoughby. It passes approximately half a kilometre from our school. The Oxford Canal goes on to link up with the Grand Union Canal at Braunston, which in turn links the rural district with London.At Napton There is a junction with the Birmingham and Warwick Canal. Because of the demand for holidays on the canals in recent years, a company has been established near Hillmorton Locks to hire canal boats.
